subject: Design
title: Chinoiserie: The West's Fantasy of the East
description: A short lesson to help you apply Chinoiserie: The West's Fantasy of the East.

hook.text: In the 1700s, European aristocrats decorated rooms with lacquered cabinets and pagoda motifs. None of it was accurate.

buildup.text: Chinoiserie blended Chinese, Japanese, and Southeast Asian elements into a European fantasy.

discovery.text: Most designers had never been to Asia. They worked from travelers' sketches and their own imagination.

twist.text: Chinoiserie tells us more about European desires than Asian design â€” it was cultural projection.

climax.text: This trend reveals how design absorbs, remixes, and often distorts foreign cultures.

punchline.text: The most popular 'Asian' design in history was entirely European.

quiz.question: What was chinoiserie?
options: A European fantasy inspired by Asian motifs
